intro: Ceropegia tirasmontana, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces tubular, fragrant blooms that are typically pink or white, attracting specific pollinators. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. Ceropegia tirasmontana is adapted to grow in rocky, arid environments and requires well-draining soil and bright, indirect light.
